data.value: Number of stored values, including explicit zeros
This can be instantiated in several ways:

value: with a dense matrix or rank-2 ndarray D
with another sparse matrix S (equivalent to S.tocsc())
to construct an empty matrix with shape (M, N)
dtype is optional, defaulting to dtype='d'.
is the standard CSC representation where the row indices for
and their corresponding values are stored in
not supplied, the matrix dimensions are inferred from

data.value: Sparse matrices can be used in arithmetic operations: they support addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, and matrix power.
efficient arithmetic operations CSC + CSC, CSC * CSC, etc.
fast matrix vector products (CSR, BSR may be faster)
changes to the sparsity structure are expensive (consider LIL or DOK)
